meanings.sent1: The vidette on horseback watched for any approaching danger.
meanings.sent2: The vidette stood on the hill, scanning the horizon for any signs of movement.
meanings.sent3: The vidette on the lookout spotted a squirrel and thought it was an enemy spy!
meanings.sent4: The vidette's role as a scout was crucial in detecting the enemy's movements.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vidette on horseback under the vast sky stayed in his mind.

meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a vidette's, always vigilant and observant.

meanings.definition: A small outpost or guard post
meanings.sent1: The soldiers built a vidette near the river to keep watch over the camp.
meanings.sent2: The vidette at the edge of the forest was barely visible among the trees.
meanings.sent3: The vidette outpost was so tiny, it could only fit one person at a time.
meanings.sent4: The vidette post was like a tiny island in the vast sea of wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The vidette's duty was to guard the outpost with unwavering dedication.
